entry.content:
My goal for this hub is to network with some of my friends and neighbors who have expressed interest in high quality food access, and willing to work together.

To me, 'high quality food access' optimizes locality, freshness, seasonality, healthy diets and mindbendingly delicious recipies that inspire us to reach out more to one another, while creating healthy containers for positive interaction with other members of the general community.

This food hub is live as of this writing:

https://nedfoodhub.herokuapp.com

  I am currenty working on adding some of my products.

entry.title: Tiny Food Canton
entry.summary: Tiny Food got its start talking to farmers in the Canton region, and studying what the Open Food Network had accomplished in its first…
entry.content:
Tiny Food got its start talking to farmers in the Canton region, and studying what the Open Food Network had accomplished in its first ten years of steady growth internationally.  There was an expressed need for better visibility for local food sources and access to new markets to help them grow their businesses.  The region is beautiul and has many residents who have grown up with a rich farming history and way of life.

Tiny Food is not a service to assist the elite of our society, rather it is a way to lift up and appreciate those who are the providers. 

We recognize that there is wealth of land knowlege in practice in the north country, and it is our goal to credit those who have worked hard to develop their own methodologies and it is our highest hope that through the use of this project new farmers are connected to good learning opportunities supporting a well informed next generation of sustainable agriculture practitioners.

https://www.traderjoes.com/fearless-flyer

The sites we are developing are live here:

North Country Shoppers Hub  https://northcountry.herokuapp.com

North Country Farmers Hub  https://northcountryfarmers.herokuapp.com

Northcountry Tiny Food App making use of both: http://northcountry.now.sh

entry.content:
TinyFood.org's goals are in parallel with the values set out by the Open Food Network to help foster a deeper understanding with the land through con

Vision to co-create the global commons

Relationships food, all of life, and spirit our our existance.

Farmers and producers dedicated to ecosystem regenerative forms of agriculture, that (re)build resilient natural systems, taking into account soil, air, water and biodiversity.

 

Transparency in the software platform and the organisation.

Empowerment to create the lives people want for themselves through a real say in their food system.

Subsidiarity problem solving approach at the lowest appropriate level  

People First with people systems, where care and empathy for each other through solidarity, diversity, inclusivity and tolerance

Constant Evolution requiring constant adaptation and agility.

Systemic global change to address the root cause of current ills, not its symptoms.

 

So if OFN Exists, why Tiny Food?

Tiny food is built on software that is over 10 years more modern than the core CMS being used for the OFN platform.   TF is working to transition new users with the flexibility of Saleor software platform, and has have good success creating new instances for new user groups and use cases on heroku, free of charge.  This low bar for participation excites the team as we see new relevancy in the states, Kenya and beyond.

 

 

We are a network which supports new users by allowing them to easily create their own 'nodes' on the network, or test instances of Tiny Food's underlying software .  Nodes can be kept private, or used collectively by a small group.  A small group of community members who have an interest in seeing a more vibrant local food economy can come together by creating a new instance and making use of the secure app provided by heroku . (ie. [your food hub name].herokuapp.com

Simplicity and Freedom

You are free to download and change our software to your own needs as per this license. You are encouraged, but not required to share special customizations back to the network.

 

Run your own hub, or get help.

New test and live instances for small groups can be deployed quickly with the use of the heroku launch button below. Code for this application depends upon the uptream . Please be aware of its issue queue,  downloadable here, and can be worked on easily via git, as we are open to pull requests related to customizing Saleor.  The project currently has 4854 stars an

 

UN Special Rapporteur on the right to food,

According to Oliver de Schutter has 3 rules for food he came to impose on himself:

1- to consume local as much as possible

2- fair trade focus for tropical products with support for communities around the source to develop social projects

3- favor fresh products that are cooked at home, rather than processed or ultra-processed

entry.title: Co-operating a Food Hub
entry.summary: TinyFood.org strives to educate while improving access to high quality food. Our approach is to support the development of food hubs. Our goals are…
entry.content:
TinyFood.org strives to educate while improving access to high quality food. Our approach is to support the development of food hubs. Our goals are basic... to make it possible for low income families to afford predominantly organic, locally sourced sustainable foods.

Why not simply use OFN? Why re-create the wheel?

We believe that high quality food is a human right,  Science has show us that consumption of high quality food prevents disease, increases congitive and metabolic functions, and speeds up the healing process.  Food connects us to our cultural, economic and environmental sustainability, and effects our community, family, and personal wellbeing.  By networking common needs, and enabling small groups to privately control their own food hub ordering systems, we aim to see huge benefit and transformation in these areas. of our lives and society.

entry.content:
There are several roles to fill in effective food hub.

Farmers - Farmers can use the "Deploy to Heroku" button to create a new private Tiny Food instance. This service sets up a secure ecommerce system which is ready to integrate with a free Stripe account.  free of charge, and uses a git service like, Github, gitlab, or Bitbucket to host the code which builds the app on heroku.

  

The button above, launches your own private instance of the latest Tiny Food hub ecommerce system.  The service makes use of Saleor as our shopping cart and inventory management.  Staff members can be added with specific permissions. We are currently working to add a 'farmer/producer login' and working from the following code branch:

https://github.com/SustainableCommunityDevelopmentHub/saleor/tree/Farmer-login
